meanings.definition: The state of being extremely tired or fatigued.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of work, he felt the exhaustions creeping in.
meanings.sent2: Her face showed signs of exhaustions after running a marathon.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics led to the exhaustions of its owner.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world seemed to rest on her shoulders, causing deep exhaustions.
meanings.sent5: The exhaustion in his eyes mirrored the long journey he had been through.

meanings.definition: The act of using up all resources or possibilities.
meanings.sent1: The exhaustions of the food supplies left them with nothing to eat.
meanings.sent2: The exhaustions of the budget forced them to reconsider their plans.
meanings.sent3: The exhaustions of the game's strategies made it more challenging.
meanings.sent4: The exhaustions of the conversation topics led to an awkward silence.
meanings.sent5: The exhaustions of options left them with only one choice.

meanings.definition: The process of completely emptying something.
meanings.sent1: The exhaustions of the water tank caused a shortage in the village.
meanings.sent2: The exhaustions of the fuel tank left them stranded on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The exhaustions of the cookie jar surprised the kids.
meanings.sent4: The exhaustions of the ink cartridge halted the printing process.
meanings.sent5: The exhaustions of the battery drained the power from the device.
